title: 'Ciao, Carpaccio!' Painter's Reputation No Longer Sliced Thin
teaser: Jan Morris's new book is an ode to Renaissance painter Vittore Carpaccio. Yes, the thinly sliced meat is named after him. NPR's Scott Simon talks to Morris about her life, work and favorite painter.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
